content.description: A nice wide vertical crack with a few jams and ample face holds.
content.location: Locate the obvious twin vertical cracks that can be seen from the road when looking up at the ¨roadside¨ crag. Climb the wide crack on the left to the visible chains.

content.description: right of out to lunch. same face. easy warmup routes.
content.location: see marty karabin map. In between out to lunch and cowpoke.

content.description: TR route to the left of Five Jive
content.location: Left of Five Jive. Short crag a few steps north of parking/camping area.

content.description: Nice route.  Good quality rock; this climb has seen enough traffic to clean the route.  One crux about four bolts up; it will be obvious-look up and left for larger crimps at the crux.  This climb stays on you, but rests can be found.
content.protection: Nine bolts.  Two hangers at the top (with slings) and rings.
content.location: On the left side of the road that terminates at the saddle.  This climb is located on the front face of the first real formation uphill from the road.

content.description: 3 bolt face to 2 cold shuts.  Moderate climbing with maybe one 5.8 move between the 2nd and 3rd bolts.  Note - originally rated 5.7 in the Karabin guide book, but 5.8 in the foldout topo.
content.location: The Road Area of Lower Devil's Canyon; south and slightly west of the parking area.
left of cow poke. see marty karabin map.

content.description: I think that some holds must have broken off this route, because it is a bit stiff between the first and second clip.  I found this route difficult to read, but very fun.  And, the route stays on you; it is a bit pumpy.
content.protection: Bolted; five bolts but I added one piece (small cam) up higher.  Two hangers at the top, for belaying, but you cannot rap.
content.location: North of the road on the approach to the saddle.  One of several climbs in a cluster located on the West most formation of three adjacent pillars.  I suspect that you will need the Marty Karabin guide to find this short gem.

climbs.name: Hollywood Nights
climbs.fa: Pat Gilbreath, Steve Rogalski, Mark Harris

content.description: another short and challenging route near the road
content.location: See Marty Karabin Map. Left of velcro gloves and rubber boots. NW of camping/parking area.

content.protection:
3 bolts

 This route has had bolts added to it. Total of 5 now, plus quick clip anchor at the top.
content.location: see Marty Karabin fold-out map. NW of parking area near large anthill.

content.description: Up a short crack to a ledge, then 5 bolts up steep featured face to a 2 bolt anchor with rings. Great fun!
content.protection: 5 shiny bolts, + a small cam for the start if so desired
content.location: West face of western-most buttress uphill of the road as you approach the parking area

content.description: Easy face climb with horizontal cracks and pockets for placements.  There are two hangers at the base of the mushroom top. If you stop here the climbing is under 5.8. If you continue to the top, the climbing is around 5.8 and you must downclimb to the rap anchors on hand jive (five jive?) to then rappel to the ground or walk off to the east.
content.protection: Small to medium gear.  Two bolts on top below the mushroom top. Down climb then rap from five jive or walk down east if you top out. Rap off from bolts below the top if you stop here.
content.location: The Road Area of Lower Devil's Canyon, just NE of the parking area.

climbs.name: Five Jive
climbs.fa: Perry Teeters, Mark Trainor, Marty Karabin

content.description: A short straight-forward climb up the west face with plenty of feet and hand holds.  This rock formation is a good place for beginners to play on - it's a short approach from the saddle parking area and the west face of this rock formation can be set up with a couple of top ropes for 5.4-5.5 range climbs.
content.protection: Climb past two bolts to a two-shut anchor.  The first bolt is possibly a bit high for a beginner lead climber but there are also many options for trad protection along the entire route.
content.location: Five Jive is the climb on the south face to the left of Amilosaurus (5.8).  Both climbs share the same anchors.
Just past parking area..when you hit the fence route is directly to your left.

content.description: This area includes the routes found in the Lower Devils Canyon area immediately adjacent to the road.
